alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Union; Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hudson, southeastern Union, Richmond, Kings and New York (Manhattan) Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Edison, or near New Brunswick, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jersey City, Elizabeth, Flatbush, Bayonne, Hoboken, Linden, Coney Island, Todt Hill, Crown Heights, Huguenot, Midtown Manhattan, The Verrazano Narrows Bridge, Canarsie, Bay Ridge and Lower East Side. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern New Jersey...and southeastern New York.
